body:
Thanks for reporting this with a bisection.

I think this is because the size values don't round trip properly though strings and the new config system does that 

So

"2B" -> 2 -> "2" -> 2048

Not sure how to fix this yet!

This has not been trivial to fix! My diagnosis was correct but my first fix broke too many things so I had to try again.

Remind me when we make rclone 2.0 that we should change SizeSuffix values to be in bytes not kBytes if they don't have a suffix - that was at the root of the problem. We did that for backwards compatibility with rsync but it catches everyone out. Maybe I'll make the use of SizeSuffix values without a suffix generate a warning to prepare everyone...

Here is a beta to try.

[v1.70.0-beta.8631.fec62ef2e.fix-8437-max-size-v2](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8437-max-size-v2/v1.70.0-beta.8631.fec62ef2e.fix-8437-max-size-v2/) on branch [fix-8437-max-size-v2](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8437-max-size-v2) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Note that I've made --min-size and --max-size appear in dump filters. So before - note how the `B` has changed to `Ki`

```
$ rclone ls --dump filters -vv --max-depth 1 /tmp/src --max-size 2B 2>&1
--- start filters ---
Maximum size is: 2 Ki
--- File filter rules ---
--- Directory filter rules ---
--- end filters ---
```

After - all fixed

```
$ rclone ls --dump filters -vv --max-depth 1 /tmp/src --max-size 2B 2>&1
2025/03/12 17:39:54 NOTICE: Automatically setting -vv as --dump is enabled
--- start filters ---
Maximum size is: 2 B
--- File filter rules ---
--- Directory filter rules ---
--- end filters ---
```

Good job @ncw! I had a similar discovery some 4 years ago, and created issue https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5169 describing my findings, but the issue lead to nothing and was just closed. Great to see it finally fixed. ü•≥ 

There is also an open issue https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8212 which I linked to the same case, and should be closed by your fix.

issue.title: copy/sync --min-size byte suffix (B) gets ignored and value gets interpreted as KiB

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I cannot use `rclone copy --min-size XB` to filter out files that are below X bytes. It somehow ignores the `B` suffix and interprets the value as `KiB`.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

I tested it with v1.68.2 and with beta.

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

I tried it on my local Arch Linux machine and with docker

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Bug occurs when just copying from local file system to local file system, but I think it will occur for any storage system.

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

The easiest to reproduce is using this docker command that show cases the full problem without any required pre-setup:

```
docker run --entrypoint sh rclone/rclone:1.68.2 -c "
mkdir /tmp/source && \
mkdir /tmp/target && \
dd if=/dev/zero of=/tmp/source/file-with-1023-bytes.txt bs=1023 count=1 status=none && \
dd if=/dev/zero of=/tmp/source/file-with-1024-bytes.txt bs=1024 count=1 status=none && \
rclone copy /tmp/source /tmp/target --min-size 1B -vv && \
ls /tmp/target
"
```

I tried also with beta replacing `rclone/rclone:1.68.2` with `rclone/rclone:beta` in above call but the result is the same. Also if I replace `rclone copy` with `rclone sync` the result is the same. Furthermore, if I replace `--min-size 1B` with `--min-size 2B` both files get excluded which shows that the value gets interpreted as `KiB` instead of `B`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

The output I get with above docker command is:

```
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "/tmp/source" "/tmp/target" "--min-size" "1B" "-vv"]
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/tmp/source"
2024/11/27 22:55:02 NOTICE: Config file "/config/rclone/rclone.conf" not found - using defaults
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/tmp/target"
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : file-with-1023-bytes.txt: Excluded (Size Filter)
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : file-with-1023-bytes.txt: Excluded
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : file-with-1024-bytes.txt: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : Local file system at /tmp/target: Waiting for checks to finish
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : Local file system at /tmp/target: Waiting for transfers to finish
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : file-with-1024-bytes.txt: md5 = 0f343b0931126a20f133d67c2b018a3b OK
2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : file-with-1024-bytes.txt.1a99980b.partial: renamed to: file-with-1024-bytes.txt
2024/11/27 22:55:02 INFO  : file-with-1024-bytes.txt: Copied (new)
2024/11/27 22:55:02 INFO  :
Transferred:   	        1 KiB / 1 KiB, 100%, 0 B/s, ETA -
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         0.0s

2024/11/27 22:55:02 DEBUG : 8 go routines active
file-with-1024-bytes.txt
```

As we see the 1023 bytes large file gets excluded by the size filter although the size filter is 1B which should be 1 byte.

issue.title: Size options can not be set to value less than 1K

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

In general it is not possible to configure size (SizeSuffix type) options with a value less than 1K. E.g. `--jottacloud-md5-memory-limit=1B` will set the option to 1024 bytes  (1K) instead of 1 byte as requested (ignore the meaning of the option, it is just a random example). Perhaps only an "academic" issue, if there currently are no options where values less than 1K is relevant?

Part of the explanation is that the "ToString" and "FromString" of SizeSuffix are "mismatched": The `String()` function will output a value without suffix if < 1K. The `Set()` function will default interpret strings without suffix as KiB, and expects strings with suffix "B" for byte values.
The other part of the explanation is the handling and parsing of option: The input "1B" is correctly parsed into a SizeSuffix value 1, but it is somewhere along the way (via `Set` function in configstruct, I think) made into a string and back to a SizeSuffix - which triggers the first part of the explanation.

The following test (which has not been committed anywhere) illustrates the first part of the explanation:

```
func TestSizeSuffixStringSet(t *testing.T) {
	for _, v := range []float64{
		0,                         // "0"
		102,                       // "102" <-- FAILS: expected: 102 ("102B"), actual: 104448 ("102Ki")
		1024,                      // "1Ki"
		1024 * 1024,               // "1Mi"
		1024 * 1024 * 1024,        // "1Gi"
		10 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024,   // "10Gi"
		10.1 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024, // "10.100Gi"
	} {
		ss1 := SizeSuffix(v)
		ss1s := ss1.String()
		ss2 := SizeSuffix(0)
		err := ss2.Set(ss1s)
		require.NoError(t, err, ss1s)
		assert.Equal(t, int64(ss1), int64(ss2))
	}
}
```

Detected as part of testing https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5087. I *may* look further into the case as part of that pull request, but no promises... :)

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.55.0-DEV (built from master as of 25 Mar 2021)

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
 
Windows 10, 64-bit

body:
Thanks for pointing those out @albertony 

Your initial diagnosis in #5169 is correct - it is the non value preserving roundtrip through string that is the problem. I tried fixing that first which worked but it broke too many other things with `B` suffixes appearing where they shouldn't. My second attempt is laser focussed on the Option parsing which fixes this issue, #5169 and #8212 

While I was thinking about it I make a wiki page for backwards incompatible changes we should make to any potential v2 of rclone. Any suggestions appreciated :-)

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/wiki/Breaking-changes-for-v2
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.70
